section.section: There shall be one nonvoting student member on the Talbot County Board of Education.
The student member shall advise the other members of the county board on the viewpoint of students who attend Talbot County public schools.

The nonvoting student member of the county board shall be:
A regularly enrolled 11th or 12th grade student in good standing at a Talbot County public school;
Qualified according to eligibility requirements established by the county board; and
Of good character.
The student member shall be appointed for a 1-year term during the school year prior to the school year that the member is to serve on the county board.
The position of student member shall alternate annually between a student from St. Michaels High School and Easton High School.
The county board shall adopt procedures for the appointment of the student member.

If a vacancy in the position of student member occurs during the term of the student member, the county board shall appoint another student member to fill the vacancy in accordance with its procedures.
Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session of the county board.
